message.content: {"id": "49299", "title": "Bug 49299 - Incorrect behavior of custom cookie name affecting URL rewriting in Servlet 3.0", "description": "Bug 49299 - In chapter 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is stated that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will also be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session id is encoded in the URL (provided that URL rewriting has been enabled). However, the actual result shows that the page sends a cookie with a different name and the Reload link on the page uses the default 'jsessionid' parameter instead, thereby inconsistent with the specification.", "OB": "The page sends the following cookie: Set-Cookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnly", "EB": "Instead of using the specified custom cookie name 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE', the default 'jsessionid' is used as the name of the URI parameter for session id encoding in the URL.", "SR": "Reproducible steps: 1. Deploy the attached 'cookiename.war' file. 2. Access http://localhost:8080/cookiename/3."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '49299', 'title': 'Bug 49299Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting', 'description': 'Bug 49299Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting ', 'OB': 'Created attachment 25442 [details]cookiename.warIn chapter 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf it is said that"If a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, thesame custom name will also be used as the name of the URI parameter if the sessionid is encoded in the URL (provided that URL rewriting has been enabled). Actual result:The page sends the following cookie:SetCookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnlybut the Reload link on the page uses "jsessionid":http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;jsessionid=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F4. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': '"That is not true for the current trunk: the default "jsessionid" is used instead.I am attaching a war file that reproduces this issue.Steps to reproduce:1. Deploy it as cookiename.war2. Access http://localhost:8080/cookiename/3. '}
